answers.text: exposure to air pollution and allergens

qas.question: What medications can also trigger asthma?
What patterns are used to diagnose asthma?

answers.text: the pattern of symptoms, response to therapy over time, and spirometry
according to the frequency of symptoms, forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1), and peak expiratory flow rate

plausible_answers.text: a combination of genetic and environmental factors

qas.question: How does usng aspirin activate allergens in others?

plausible_answers.text: medications such as aspirin and beta blockers

qas.question: What are some triggers of spirometry?

plausible_answers.text: based on the pattern of symptoms, response to therapy over time, and spirometry

qas.question: How do you know if you are affected by spirometry?

plausible_answers.text: according to the frequency of symptoms, forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1), and peak expiratory flow rate

qas.question: How do you classify spirometry in people?
What two categories can spirometry also be classified into?
